column1: # The following lines contain the tickets in the system
# There are two types of tickets: open tickets and already resolved tickets.
# Both tickets start with: Type(hardware or software
column2: Username of the user that created the ticket
column3: Report time (when was the problem reported)
column4: Machine id or Software name (depending on the type)

column2: Username of the troubleShooter that resolved the problem
column4: Resolved time (when was the problem fixed)

column5: Where is the power button of my computer?
column7: The powerbutton is on the backside of the Macintosh machine.

column5: My computer contains MacOS, but I am a Windows user...
I am stuck at level 15 of Angry Birds
column7: Stop fooling around and get back to work. BTW: touch the screen twice to let the blue birds split.

column5: How can I connect a mouse to my computer?
column7: A mouse contains a USB-connector which attached to the USB-port of the system. It is a simple plug and play operation which you can perform yourself.

column5: Help, my computer contains a virus. Is it contagious to humans?
